title: How to Make Cheese Balls

steps.headline: Stir 1 cup (225 g) of cream cheese in a mixing bowl to smoothen the texture.
steps.description: Use an offset spatula or a sturdy spoon to break up the clump of cream cheese. Then, stir the cream cheese around the mixing bowl until it has a smooth, creamy consistency. Consider softening the cream cheese by letting it rest on the counter at room temperature for 20-30 minutes. This will make it easier to stir in the other ingredients.

steps.headline: Mix in 1 cup (125 g) of shredded sharp cheddar cheese into the bowl.
steps.description: Stir the cheese with the cream cheese until both ingredients are blended together. Scrape down the sides of the bowl using to the offset spatula if needed before adding any other ingredients. Instead of a sharp cheddar cheese, have fun experimenting with other types. Use 1 cup (125 g) of shredded Swiss cheese for a tangy flavor, or 1 cup (125 g) of shredded pepper jack cheese for a spicy flavor. Blend two different cheese together. For example, round out the sharpness of a 1/2 cup (62.5) of shredded cheddar cheese with a 1/2 cup (62.5) of Swiss cheese.

steps.headline: Add 1 chopped green onion and stir the mixture until it is blended.
steps.description: Use your offset spatula to pull the mixture up from the bottom of the bowl so the green onion is distributed evenly. The subtle bitterness of the green onion will contrast the creaminess of the cheeses nicely. Use more than 1 chopped green onion if you notice that the smell or flavor of it is not strong. Green onions have a subtle flavor, but sometimes you may get a batch that has less flavor than others do. Use your best judgment on how much to add, and taste the mixture before adding any more.

steps.headline: Season the cheese mixture with 1/4 tsp (1.25 g) of black pepper.
steps.description: Mix in the black pepper thoroughly so that the flavor is evenly distributed. Consider adding additional seasonings to the cheese mixture if desired. Contrast the creaminess of the mixture with salty bacon bits or small dices of ham to taste. Make the cheese mixture spicy by adding in ⁄2  tsp (2.5 mL) of hot sauce or Worcestershire sauce, or 1/4 tsp (1.25) of ground red pepper. Give the cheese mixture a subtle earthy flavor by adding 1/4 tsp (1.25) of thyme, rosemary, or oregano leaves. Transform the cheese ball into a sweet dessert dip by omitting the cheddar cheese and black pepper. Then, add in ⁄2  tsp (2.5 mL) of vanilla extract, 2 US tbsp (30 mL) of lemon juice, 3 tbsp (15 g) freshly grated lemon zest, 1/3 cup (66.7 g) of granulated sugar, 3 tbsp (37.5 g) of brown sugar, and 1/2 cup (115 g) of softened butter.

steps.headline: Use the offset spatula to form the mixture into a ball in the bowl.
steps.description: Scrape down the sides of the bowl to make sure you get all of the cheese mixture. Pat it in the center of the bowl until it roughly forms the shape of a ball. This will make it easier to remove it from the bowl.

steps.headline: Pour your finely crushed pecans into a small bowl to use as a coating.
steps.description: Break up any large pieces with your fingers, as these will be hard to scoop with a cracker when the cheese ball is served. Mix in other crushed nuts if desired to further flavor the coating. Instead of finely chopped pecans, use a different nut like almonds, walnuts, or pistachios. Alternatively, use finely crushed seasoned bread crumbs or crushed tortilla chips to coat the cheese ball to give it an added crunch. Cover a dessert-type of cheese ball with crushed cookies, like gingersnaps, or even chocolate chips.

steps.headline: Coat your hands with olive oil and hold the cheese ball in one hand.
steps.description: Gently cradle the cheese ball in your hand to avoid puncturing it with your fingers. Smooth out any imperfections to its roundness if necessary.

steps.headline: Use your other hand to press the pecans around the cheese ball.
steps.description: Carefully press the pecans onto the cheese ball and rotate it as needed to cover the entire surface. Hold the cheese ball over your mixing bowl so that it catches any pecans that do not stick. Continue this process until the entire cheese ball is covered. Alternatively, you can roll the cheese ball over a layer of the crushed pecans to coat it, but this will require more pecans to properly coat it. This is because the weight of the cheese ball will press the pecans inside rather than just coat it.

steps.headline: Plate the cheese ball and serve it with an assortment of dipping items.
steps.description: Center the cheese ball on the plate. Then, surround the plate with crackers, pretzels, bread sticks, or tortilla chips for people to use as dipping items. If you have multiple dipping items, then divide them into smaller bowls that surround your cheese ball plate. If your cheese ball seems soft, cover it with plastic wrap and allow it to firm up in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Store leftovers in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
steps.description: Place your leftover cheese ball into a container that has a lid with a tight seal. Then, put the container in the refrigerator and enjoy eating the cheese ball over the next 2 weeks.

steps.headline: Pour 2 cups (250 g) of shredded sharp cheddar cheese into a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Break up any large clumps of the shredded cheese with your fingers. This will help the flour coat the cheese better when creating the dough. The cheese can be shredded fine or thick, but should not be stuck together or frozen. Experiment with different cheese types or mix some together to create different flavor pairings. Give the cheese balls an extra bite by mixing together 1 cup (125 g) of shredded sharp cheddar cheese and shredded Swiss cheese. Alternatively, add some spice to the cheese balls by mixing together 1 cup (125 g) of shredded mozzarella cheese and pepper jack cheese.

steps.headline: Mix in 1 1/4 cups (150 g) of all-purpose flour into the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to stir in the flour as you sprinkle it into the bowl. Continue mixing the cheese and flour until both ingredients are blended. If your flour has a lot of lumps in it, run it through a sieve before adding it into the bowl with the cheese. Add seasonings to the flour before mixing it in with the cheese to elevate the flavor of the finished cheese balls. Consider mixing in 1/4 tsp (1.25 g) of salt, freshly ground black pepper or paprika to the flour.

steps.headline: Microwave 1/2 cup (225 g) of butter for 20 seconds to melt it.
steps.description: Put the butter into a microwavable container, and crack the lid on top of the container. This will allow the butter to aerate as it melts and keep it from spattering. Microwave the butter for 20 seconds or until it is completely melted. If you do not want to use butter, you can substitute it with equal amounts of margarine.

steps.headline: Stir the melted butter into the flour and cheese mixture to make the dough.
steps.description: Pour the butter into the bowl with the flour and cheese. Use a rubber spatula to thoroughly blend the butter into the mixture. When mixed, the dough should be dense and moist. Mix the dough with your hands if needed to finish blending the ingredients together. Add 1  tsp (4.9 mL) of water to the dough if it seems crumbly. This may especially be needed if you added diced vegetables or meat to the dough.

steps.headline: Experiment with flavors by adding diced vegetables or cooked meat.
steps.description: Add a finely diced vegetable or shredded meat to the cheese and flour mixture to give the light appetizer a hearty texture. Refrain from picking more than 1 additional ingredient to keep the finished dough from becoming crumbly. For example, make breaded chicken cheese balls with a sweet chili sauce. Create the dough by mixing 3 shredded cooked chicken breasts, 1 cup (125 g) shredded mozzarella cheese, 3–4 US tbsp (44–59 mL) of mayonnaise, 2 US tbsp (30 mL) of sweet chili sauce, and 1 egg. Then, roll the dough into ball and coat with an egg wash, flour, and breadcrumbs. Substitute the flour for crunchy panko breadcrumbs and make a pan of broccoli cheese balls. Create the dough by mixing together 1 cup (125 g) panko breadcrumbs, 2 cups (312 g) chopped steamed broccoli, 2 eggs, 3/4 cup (93.75 g) of shredded cheddar cheese, and 1/4 tsp (1.25 g) of salt and black pepper. Then, consider adding 2 cloves of minced garlic and scallions to round out the flavors.

steps.headline: Place marble-sized balls of dough onto an ungreased baking sheet.
steps.description: Break off a small piece of dough that is roughly the size of a marble and roll it with your hands. Place the ball of dough onto the baking sheet. Leave 1–2 in (2.5–5.1 cm) of space between each row and column of dough balls. To make the process move faster, use a teaspoon as a small scoop to break off pieces of dough that are the same size. If you did not add additional vegetables or meat to your dough, consider stuffing the cheese balls as you roll them. For example, take your portioned piece of dough and wrap it evenly around a pimento-stuffed olive or a small dice of cooked chicken.

steps.headline: Cover the baking sheet with plastic wrap and refrigerate it for 1 hour.
steps.description: Maintain the shape of the cheese ball by chilling the dough in the refrigerator before baking. This will give the handled dough a chance to firm and will keep it from spreading or flattening in the oven.

steps.headline: Bake the chilled cheese balls in the oven at 350 °F (177 °C) for 15 minutes.
steps.description: Check on the cheese balls after the 15 minutes. The tops of the cheese balls should have a light, golden-brown coloring. If the cheese balls still appear doughy or pale, continuing baking them for another 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Arrange the cheese balls on a platter and serve immediately.
steps.description: Create a single layer of cheese balls on a platter to keep them from getting soggy as they cool. Just be careful when eating the cheese balls after they come out of the oven, as they may still be very hot. Store leftovers in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to a week.
